other_details.en: Rome IV criteria for the diagnosis of child cyclic vomiting syndrome.

when: $gt0003|The occurrence of ≥2 periods of intense, unremitting nausea and paroxysmal vomiting, lasting hours to days within a 6-month period| == true
$gt0004|Episodes are stereotypical in each patient| == true
$gt0005|Episodes are separated by weeks to months with return to baseline health between episodes| == true
$gt0006|After appropriate medical evaluation, the symptoms cannot be attributed to another condition| == true

( $gt0003|The occurrence of ≥2 periods of intense, unremitting nausea and paroxysmal vomiting, lasting hours to days within a 6-month period| != true || $gt0004|Episodes are stereotypical in each patient| != true || $gt0005|Episodes are separated by weeks to months with return to baseline health between episodes| != true || $gt0006|After appropriate medical evaluation, the symptoms cannot be attributed to another condition| != true )

gt0003.text: The occurrence of ≥2 periods of intense, unremitting nausea and paroxysmal vomiting, lasting hours to days within a 6-month period

gt0004.text: Episodes are stereotypical in each patient

gt0005.text: Episodes are separated by weeks to months with return to baseline health between episodes

gt0006.text: After appropriate medical evaluation, the symptoms cannot be attributed to another condition
